title: Ticket #5747: Blahp escapes double-quotes to arguments
description:
HTCondor's blahp adds escaped double-quotes to the executable arguments, causing jobs to fail. For example, here's a snippet from Slurm submit script generated by an HTCondor-CE-Bosco: 

/home/bosco/bosco/sandbox/dcf4/dcf40857/fermicloud012.fnal.gov_9619_fermicloud012.fnal.gov#60.0#1466703381/condor_exec.exe "-e\" \"foo\" \"bar\" \"baz"

And here's a snippet from a HTCondor-CE/Slurm setup using the OSG's blahp: 

/var/lib/condor-ce/spool/43/0/cluster43.proc0.subproc0/echo "-e" "foo" "bar" "baz"

This does not appear to be a difference in the blahp scripts and I didn't notice any obvious differences that would cause this in server.c. {endcode}
remarks:
2016-Jun-29 15:56:37 by bbockelm:
There's a patch for this that I did in the OSG blahp; ping me when you get back from vacation and we can go git history diving.

2016-Jul-05 15:27:20 by blin:
BrianB believes that this commit was the OSG's solution to escaped double quotes in the arguments:

https://github.com/osg-bosco/BLAH/commit/6c08440dcc2a2f61916488e6c5144258c59e07d3

2016-Jul-06 14:29:16 by jfrey:
If I apply this patch to our blahp, then all arguments are enclosed in double quotes that the application sees.

2016-Jul-06 14:34:31 by jfrey:
In a related problem, if the HTCondor submit file uses the old arguments syntax, then any single quotes in the arguments causes the blahp submission to fail. The blahp slaps single quotes around the entire arguments string, which wordexp() doesn't like.

2016-Jul-06 15:29:46 by jfrey:
Some more problems with the patch applied:

  • Spaces that should be part of an argument end up as argument separators.
  • Single quotes that should be part of an argument vanish.

There are probably equivalent problems without the patch.

I used the following example from the HTCondor Manual: 

arguments = "one ""two"" 'spacey ''quoted'' argument'"

2016-Jul-07 14:14:38 by jfrey:
The OSG's blahp doesn't exhibit the problems I'm seeing. I'm guessing that's due to it being based on a newer version of the blahp code.

I think I have a fix for the UW build's blahp. I need to run a few more tests, though.

2016-Aug-15 16:28:17 by blin:
Any word on how those tests turned out, Jaime?

2016-Aug-16 08:31:48 by jfrey:
The checkin I made for this ticket fixes most of the quoting problems. It'll be part of 8.5.7.
